definitions.definition: A word or phrase adding emphasis, such as "a lot" or "really".

definitions.example: He gave me an emphatic no when I asked him out.

definitions.definition: (grammar) Belonging to a set of English tense forms comprising the auxiliary verb do + an infinitive without to.
Belonging to a series of obstruent consonants in several Semitic languages that are distinguished from both voiced and voiceless consonants by a certain phonetic feature or features.
